IRS990.ActivityOrMissionDesc: The mission of Dallas Theological Seminary is to glorify God by equipping godly servant-leaders for the proclamation of His Word and the building up of the body of Christ worldwide.
IRS990.MissionDesc: The mission of Dallas Theological Seminary is to glorify God by equipping godly servant-leaders for the proclamation of His Word and the building up of the body of Christ worldwide.
IRS990.Desc: INSTRUCTION: Dallas Theological Seminary (DTS) offers a variety of graduate academic programs from its main campus in Dallas, TX and its extension sites in Austin, Houston, and San Antonio, Texas; Atlanta, Georgia; Nashville, TN and Manassas, Virginia. Online courses are also offered. DTS is nondenominational and seeks to serve those of like biblical faith in evangelical protestantism. DTS has over 15,000 alumni serving in 105 countries. Fall 2017 enrollment consisted of 2,422 students, with 14,833 total class hours taken that term.

ProgSrvcAccomActy2Grp.Desc: AUXILIARY: Auxiliary enterprises consist of a student bookstore, dining facilities, two student apartment buildings, and a theological journal. Mitchell Ministry Center houses student support activites and the bookstore. Swiss Tower residence hall has 158 apartments for married students with families and includes a fireside chat room, playroom, and courtyard with a pool. Washington Hall, the single-student apartment building, contains 158 bedrooms in one and two bedroom apartments. Its amenities include a student research library that is an extension of Turpin Library, a fully outfitted computer lab, conference rooms, 2 music practice rooms, 2 media rooms, a multipurpose room/gym, and a pool. Bibliotheca Sacra, a theological quarterly, in continuous publication since 1843, has been published by DTS since 1934. Bibliotheca Sacra does not include any advertising or endorsements.

ProgSrvcAccomActy3Grp.Desc: PUBLIC SERVICE: Hendricks Center for Christian Leadership and Cultural Engagement pursues the development of effective Christian leadership in order to build leaders of integrity and impact. The Lay Institute provides biblical and theological education for personal faith enrichment.ACADEMIC SUPPORT: The library holds over 355,000 items, provides access to electronic resources and has special rare volumes. The media and computer lab allows students to use computer equipment, audio and video media.

ProgSrvcAccomActyOtherGrp.Desc: STUDENT SERVICES: The mission of student services is to ensure that every student has the opportunity to develop as a godly servant-leader through his or her social, cultural, spiritual, physical, and emotional life. We provide advisement, programming, and services to enrich community, family life, personal interaction, social development, cultural awareness, physical development and campus diversity. The admissions department works to recruit and then equip entering students with the resources needed to have a successful graduate-studies experience. The registrar and counseling offices provide advising, counseling and testing services to facilitate personal, family and professional development. The Chaplains office encourages campus community life, worship, and spiritual development through chapel programming. The Dean of Students office provides opportunities for student participation in decision-making and leadership development through student groups.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: Endowment funds intended uses (Part V, line 4)
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: Endowments are intended primarily for student aid scholarships and other academic programs.
The Seminary only participates in the Federal Direct Student Loan Program and provides administrative support.
The Seminarys racially nondiscrimminatory policy is included in its catalog and other publications.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: Use of grant monitoring procedures (Part I, line 2)
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: The student aid office requires applications from all students requesting student aid. All students receiving scholarships and grants are judged worthy by the Seminarys assessment on the basis of academic achievement, financial need, and other similar standards.Student aid for students outside the U.S. is typically a reduction of tuition owed and is rarely given directly to the student in the form of cash.
Part IV: Upon review of our foreign investments for the year, the Seminary is not required to file forms 5471, 8865, or 8621.

For fiscal year 2017/2018, the Seminary paid Todd Dexter & Associates $72,000 for consultation and analysis, and Next After, LLC $90,000 for consultation. The remaining costs were related to the printing, mailing, and other costs of our direct mail and new donor acquisition, website design, etc. For Westfall Group, Inc. the costs reported are total costs paid to them for both event planning and consultation.

Emergency aid: Students are required to substantiate a legitimate need for benevolence before money is awarded. No attempt to verify the use of the money is made.Tuition assistance: Tuition is discounted to apply aid.

Occasionally, the Presidents wife travels with him on official business, such as donor trips. The Seminary obtains documentation to verify that a bona fide business reason exists for the spousal travel, and the Seminary pays for the trip when the spouse acts in the capacity of an official Seminary delegate.Certain individuals receiving compensation are ministers of the gospel, and as such, a housing allowance is included in Other Compensation for some of the people listed in Pt. VII.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: Officer directors etc family relationship Part VI line 2
Governing body decisions Part VI line 7b
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: From the membership of the Board of Incorporate Members (Governing Board) there are assigned members to two subsidiary boards, the Board of Regents and the Board of Trustees. The Board of Regents is entrusted with the general oversight of the faculty and the educational and spiritual functions of the Seminary. The Board of Trustees is entrusted with the direction of the property and financial interests of the Seminary, and authority is given to the Board of Trustees by the bylaws to act legally for the Board of Incorporate Members in all matters of property and finance, such actions being final.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: Form 990 governing body review Part VI line 11
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: The form 990 is initially reviewed by an independent audit firm. The audit committee of the Board reviews and approves the form 990. The entire governing Board will be given the public disclosure copy after it is filed with the IRS.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: Conflict of interest policy compliance Part VI line 12c
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: Board members, officers, and key employees are required to sign a conflict of interest document once a year.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: CEO executive director top management comp Part VI line 15a
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: The Board determines the Presidents salary. An independent consulting firm prepared a compensation survey that compares the Presidents salary to similar positions at comparable not-for-profit educational institutions. The study also took into account cost of living factors from different regions.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: Other officer or key employee compensation Part VI line 15b
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: Officers who are not employees are not compensated. The Boards Compensation Committee reviews and makes recommendations of salary levels for the President and key employees. Comparable salary survey data is used.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: Form 990 availability to public Part VI line 18
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: Forms 990 and 990-T and other such documents are available upon request.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: Governing documents etc available to public Part VI line 19
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: Governing documents, conflict of interest policies and audited financial statements are available to the public upon request. Audited financial statements are also on the DTS business office website.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: Explanation of other changes in net assets or fund balances Part XI line 9
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: The change in funding status of the defined benefit pension plan, excluding net periodic pension expense is a $1,353,272 credit. Then pension plan was frozen to new employees effective January 1, 2003.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: Estimate of average hours per week devoted to related organizations Part VII Col B
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: Certain directors, officers, and key employees of the Seminary are also directors, officers, and key employees of the Seminarys affiliated foundation. The hours reflected here reflect time spent for both organizations.

Part X, lines 27-29 correlate with the financial statements as follows: Line 27 Unrestricted net assets = Net Assets Without Donor Restrictions. Line 28 Temporarily restricted net assets= Net Assets Without Donor Restrictions-Restricted by Purpose or Time. Line 29 Permanently restricted net assets = Net Assets Without Donor Restrictions-Restricted in perpetuity.
